name: Reebok Reach The Beach
intro:
Reebok Ragnar Reach The Beach (RTB) Relay is one of the oldest and longest running relay races in the United States. Reebok Reach the Beach will take place in picturesque New Hampshire during the start of the New England foliage season. The event will start at the Bretton Woods Ski area.

From there, the course will take teams through the White Mountains of New Hampshire, past fields, lakes, mountain top vistas, and the occasional covered bridge ultimately finishing along the Atlantic coastline at Hampton Beach State Park – NH.

Hampton Beach is located one hour from downtown Boston off of I-95 and is just 10 miles south of Portsmouth, NH. Its beautiful beaches and many state parks make it a major three-season tourist destination. The finish area at the Hampton Beach State Park will host a post-race party for all competitors, sponsors, volunteers, family and friends. There will also be provisions for massage, music, food, and fun.

GREAT NEWS! All 2017 Reebok Ragnar Relay captains will be receiving complimentary Reebok running shoes!! As a captain, we know you are committed to going the distance and Reebok wants your feedback. Check out our Reebok Shoes page for more info!
charity:
Reach the Beach is just around the corner. Make the weekend even more meaningful by fundraising for a Ragnar charity partner or your favorite charity on everydayhero, the official fundraising platform of Ragnar Relay Series! 

Simply go here (or click on the everydayhero logo above) and choose your favorite charity – it’s that easy!  Your fundraising page will be created and you can start making every step count.

To date, the Ragnar community has fundraised over 1 million dollars so let's keep it going! 

Questions? Email nonprofits@everydayhero.com.

Reebok Reach The Beach Charity Partners


 Reebok Ragnar Reach The Beach is proud to once again partner with JDRF to help raise funds for type 1 diabetes (T1D) research. If your team is looking to run Reebok Reach The Beach for a cause see below for details. JDRF is the leading global organization focused on T1D research. JDRF’s goal is to progressively remove the impact of T1D from people’s lives until we achieve  a world  without T1D. As the largest charitable supporter of T1D research, JDRF is currently sponsoring $450 million in charitable research worldwide, including $54 million designated  to  59 research projects at institutions in Massachusetts. If your team is looking to participate in Reach The Beach for a cause, or if you’d like to share your time and talent as a volunteer on race day, please contact Jillian Boston at 617-831-1125 or jboston@jdrf.org.


The Hole In The Wall Gang Camp

We are thrilled that The Hole in the Wall Gang Camp is joining us for the 2nd year as the signature charity of Reach the Beach 2017!  

Founded in 1988 by Paul Newman, The Hole in the Wall Gang Camp provides "a different kind of healing" to more than 25,000 seriously ill children and family members annually - all completely free of charge. For many of these children and families, Hole in the Wall provides multiple Camp experiences throughout the year at the facility in Ashford, Conn., in more than 35 hospitals and clinics, directly in camper homes and communities, and through other outreach activities across the Northeast.

It's a community that celebrates the fun, friendship and spirit of childhood, where every kid can “raise a little hell.” The Ragnar experience embodies what Camp is all about – camaraderie, challenge, and a healthy dose of crazy, good fun!

If you ran in 2016, chances are you saw their 20+ runners and received one of their awesome “buff” headbands. Their teams raised more than $14,000 during the event, all to support seriously ill children and their families.

Through our partnership, The Hole in the Wall Gang Camp is offering the opportunity to receive FREE ENTRY to Reach the Beach. Add meaning to your run and help provide “a different kind of healing” to seriously ill children and their families. Learn more on how to join The Hole in the Wall Gang Camp and help make stories like this one possible. Run Ragnar for Camp!

Edurance 4 Veterans

Providing veterans the opportunity to heal and rehabilitate through physical fitness. 

Community Organizations

The Reebok Reach The Beach tradition has become part of the amazing communities we run through. Our commitment is to leave each community better than we found it. We strive to improve lives in the very communities where we run, because they are our homes and our neighborhoods. We partner with charities and community organizations that provide the greatest good to those who need it most.  The Reebok Reach The Beach Relay is pleased to have long-term, mutually beneficial relationships with the following NH-based organizations.
A special thanks to:

updates:
The dates for 2017 are September 15-16th.  VIP registration will open on 10/26/2016.

Thank you to all who took part in the 2016 (18th running!) of the Reebok Ragnar Reach the Beach Relay.  We are thrilled with how things went and are looking forward to getting your feedback and combining that with ours to start working on the 2017 event!  

Gameface was our photographer this year and they have some amazing photos!  Check them out HERE.
volunteer_waiver:
[Type here]
RAGNAR/RTB PARTICIPANT WAIVER AND RELEASE OF LIABILITY,
ASSUMPTION OF RISK AND INDEMNITY AGREEMENT
Ragnar/RTB Form
As a condition of my participation in the above-described Event as a runner, volunteer or otherwise, I hereby covenant not to sue, and agree to release from liability, the Ragnar Relay Series, together with its founders, owners, officers, directors, managers, agents, sponsors and employees, including but not limited to (a) Ragnar Events LLC, Ragnar Holdings LLC, Reebok International Ltd, Ragnar RTB, LLC, RTB Relay, Inc., and each of their affiliates and their respective investors, officers, directors, managers, members, agents, employees, successors, heirs, assigns, executors, and administrators; (b) Ragnar Relay Series race officials and volunteers; (c) the Reach the Beach Relay race officials, volunteers and sponsors, including Reebok International (“Reebok”); (d) the State of New Hampshire, its Cities, Towns, Municipalities, agents, servants, employees, officers, and directors; (e) the NH Department of Resources and Economic Development, its agents, servants, employees, officers, and directors; (f) CLP Bretton Woods TRS Corp., CLP Bretton Woods LLC, CNL Lifestyle Properties, Inc., and Omni Hotels Management Corporation and each of their respective owners, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, successors, employees and agents; and (g) any and all other sponsors, suppliers, agents, independent contractors and other personnel in any way assisting or associated with this Event (collectively the “Releasees”). This Race Release and Waiver of Liability, and Assumption of Risk (this “Release”) is a contract with legal and binding consequences and it applies to all activities relating to the Event, whether located on the race course, exchanges or other Event-related venues. I have read this Release carefully before signing, and I understand what it means and what I am agreeing to by signing.
In consideration of the acceptance of my application for entry or participation as a volunteer in this Event by one or more Releasees, I hereby freely agree to and make the following additional contractual representations and agreements:
1. I know that this Event, which takes place both in daylight and at night, is held on open roads and is a potentially hazardous activity. I voluntarily assume full and complete responsibility for all risks associated with participating in the Event and for any injury or accident that may occur during my participation in this Event, including by way of example and not limitation: (a) illness; (b) traveling to and from the event; (c) falls; (d) collisions with pedestrians, vehicles, other participants, and fixed or moving objects; (e) the effects of weather, including temperature extremes and humidity; (f) traffic accidents; (g) the negligence of myself and/or others, including Releasees; (h) animal attacks; and (i) road conditions, including darkness and surface conditions such as pot holes.
I am aware of and appreciate all of these risks. I understand that both vehicle traffic and spectators will be present along the race course and that police protection will not be provided. I know that the presence of vehicle traffic during the Event increases the risk of motor vehicle accidents involving participants, spectators, and/or other vehicles, and that such accidents can result in death or serious injury. I further understand that the Releasees are not responsible for lost/stolen/damaged items from vehicles.
2. As a condition of my participation, I agree to abide by all traffic and pedestrian laws and regulations and to follow any and all of Releasees’ safety instructions, including all rules and conditions set forth in the Reach the Beach Relay Race Handbook, which is available on the Reach the Beach Relay Series website, www.rtbrelay.com. I understand that my failure to do so may result in serious injury or death and may be grounds for my disqualification from this Event.
3. I acknowledge that I should not enter and participate in this Event unless I am medically able and properly trained. I agree to abide by any decision of a race official relative to my ability to safely complete this road race and I further agree that race officials may authorize necessary emergency treatment for me.
4. I represent and warrant that (a) my team and I will participate fully in all of the safety training provided by the Ragnar Relay Series, Ragnar RTB, LLC, and RTB Relay Inc., and (b) they and I agree to adhere to the rules and regulations included in such safety training.
5. Having read this Release and knowing and assuming these risks, and in consideration of the acceptance of my participation, I hereby for myself, my heirs, my executors, administrators or anyone else who might claim on their own behalf or my behalf (collectively my “Successors”), covenant not to sue, and FOREVER WAIVE, RELEASE, DISCHARGE, and HOLD HARMLESS Releasees from any and all claims, injuries, damages, liabilities, causes of action, and expenses (including without limitation attorney’s fees and costs), and inconvenience to person or property (collectively, “Losses”) of any kind or nature whatsoever arising out of or related to my registration or participation in this Event, even though such Losses may arise out of negligence or carelessness on the part of Releasees.
6. In exchange for my being permitted to participate in the Event, and understanding there will be no additional compensation to me, I hereby grant Ragnar Events LLC, Reebok International Ltd, the other Releasees, and their respective agents and affiliates the perpetual right and license to photo and/or video record me during the Event and to use my name, image, voice, video, photograph, performance, likeness and biographical and other information (collectively, “Likeness”) for race promotional purposes, including, without limitation, marketing, social media, advertisements, and other promotional materials in any and all media whether now existing or hereinafter invented. I understand that I will have no right of approval over the use of my Likeness and the Releasees shall have no liability to me or anyone else for any distortion, illusionary effect or otherwise resulting from the use of my Likeness.
7. I understand the Event registration fees are nonrefundable. I have read the Reach the Beach Relay Race Handbook and agree to abide by the rules and conditions contained therein.
8. I acknowledge and agree that it is prohibited for any unmanned aerial system (more commonly known as a “drone”) to be flown above the Event course at any time during the Event, or while Event participants, either immediately before or after the Event, are in the vicinity of the Event course.
9. I acknowledge and agree, for myself and my Successors, that the above representations are contractually binding, and that should I or my Successors assert a claim contrary to what I have agreed to in this Release, the claiming party shall be liable for the expenses (including legal fees) incurred by the Releasees in defending such claim. This Release may not be modified orally, and a waiver or modification of any provision shall not be construed as a waiver or modification of any other provision herein or as consent to any subsequent waiver or modification. I consent to the release by any third party to Releasees and their insurance carriers of my name and medical information that may relate to any injury or death I may suffer arising from my participation in the Event. Every term and provision of this Release is intended to be severable. If any one or more of them is found to be unenforceable or invalid, that shall not affect the other terms and provisions, which shall remain binding and enforceable.
10. I acknowledge and agree that there are no refunds if the Event is cancelled or delayed due to causes beyond Releasees’ control, including but not limited to, acts of God, war, strikes or labor disputes, fires, riots, terrorism, vandalism, accident, government orders, failure to obtain necessary permits or approvals or consents, severe weather conditions such as severe heat, electrical storm, snowfall, tornadoes, earthquakes, hurricanes, flooding, fog, severe weather conditions where significant damage or altercations to the race course occur, or any other force majeure event.
11. I acknowledge and agree that any disputes, including any legal action, arising out of my registration or participation in this Event, shall be brought exclusively in the courts of Salt Lake County, Utah, and shall be governed by the laws of the State of Utah. I submit myself to the jurisdiction of such courts for all such purposes.
12. I agree to return Ragnar safety flags on the final day of the Event. If flags are not returned, the credit card used during registration may be charged $15 per flag to cover replacement costs.

RAGNAR/RTB MINOR WAIVER
CONSENT AND RELEASE BY PARENT OR GUARDIAN
I am the parent or guardian of the above-named minor (my “Child”). My Child is fit for the Event, and I (and, if I am married, my spouse) consent to my Child’s participation. I have read and I understand the above Release. In consideration of allowing my Child to participate, I (and, if I am married, my spouse) consent to the foregoing Release and agree that its terms shall likewise bind me (and, if I am married, my spouse), my Child, and our respective heirs, legal representatives, assignees, and anyone else who might claim on their own behalf or mine or my Child’s behalf. I (and, if I am married, my spouse) hereby forever release and discharge, and shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless Releasees, from every claim (including without limitation a claim of loss of consortium), liability, cause of action, and expense that I (and, if I am married, my spouse) or my Child or any other person may allege against any of the Releasees (including medical expenses and reasonable legal fees and costs) as a direct or indirect result of injury or death to me or my Child because of my Child’s participation in the Event, whether caused by the negligence of my Child, the Releasees, or others, to the maximum extent permitted by law. I (and, if I am married, my spouse) covenant not to sue Releasees on my behalf or on behalf of my Child for any claim arising from my Child’s participation in the Event. If I am married, I am signing this Release also in behalf of, and as authorized agent for, my spouse.
(Signature of Parent or Guardian)

meta_description: Reebok Ragnar Reach The Beach (RTB) Relay is one of the oldest and longest running relay races in the United States. Reebok Reach the Beach will take place in picturesque New Hampshire during the start of the New England foliage season. The event will start at the Bretton Woods Ski area. From there, the course will take teams through the White Mountains of New Hampshire, past fields, lakes, mountain top vistas, and the occasional covered bridge ultimately finishing along the Atlantic coastline at Hampton Beach State Park.

exchanges.name: Start Line
exchanges.description:
Location

Bretton Woods Ski Area

99 Ski Area Road

Bretton Woods, NH 03575

 

Time

Thursday, September 15th from 5:00 PM — 9:00 PM

Friday, September 16th from 5:00 AM — 4:00 PM
 

 

Sweet Happenings

Thursday September 15th, 5-9PM. 

Hole in the Wall Gang Camp Pre Race Kick-off!: Bretton Woods Main Ski Lodge

  • Dinner- 5-9PM.  $25 purchase tickets here.  Includes dinner, drinks, dessert + 1 Harpoon Beer

Partners

Addaday - Borrow an Addaday roller for the weekend with option to purchase at the finish! 

Halfpops - Delicious half popped popcorn for each runner at check-in

Nuun -  Samples and product to purchase

Nathan – Get your photo taken with the What Color is Your Pee Banner! Nathan products for purchase as well.

Bondi Band- Stop by the Bondi Band booth to purchase your moisture wicking headbands, armbands, and other must have running accessories.

Runners Alley- Running essentials for purchase from their mobile Store 

Hole in the Wall Gang Camp – Learn about how you can help their childrens camp! 

 

Friday September 16th, 5AM-3PM.  Bretton Woods Main Ski Lodge

  • Breakfast: 5:00am-11am
  • Smoothie Bar , Yogurt and Granola Parfait Station, Whole Fruit (Apple, Banana, Orange), English Muffin and Bagel Station with your choice of Cream Cheese, Peanut Butter, Butte or Jam
  • Individual Egg White, Spinach and Feta Quiche
  • Coffee, Tea, Assorted Juice
  • LUNCH: 11-2:00 Hotdogs, Hamburgers, Veggie burgers, etc..
  •

exchanges.name: Finish Line
exchanges.description:
Hampton Beach State Park

Route 1A, Hampton NH

  • B.Good Post Race Food:  Kale and Grain bowls (meat and meatless),
  • Hampton Rotary Harpoon Beer Tent:  $4 per 16oz drafts of your favorite Harpoon beers

PARTNERS

Jabra - Don't let wires hold you back. Get the ultimate workout with with Jabra's wireless sports earbuds that are sweat - and weatherproof

b.good - Food at the finish line will be provided by b.good. Real. Food. Fast.

Addaday – Roll out those muscles with a foam roller

Halfpops- sampling plus 1 Big Bag per team to enjoy in the beer tent!

NUUN -  Free samples! Purchase three tubes of nuun, get a free water bottle.  

Nathan – Get your photo taken with the What Color is Your Pee Banner! Nathan products for purchase as well.

Bondi Band- Stop by the Bondi Band booth to purchase your moisture wicking headbands, armbands, and other must have running accessories.

Runners Alley- Cheering on the finishers!

CEP Compression - Compression products to aid in your recovery

Muscle Milk - Recovery protein drinks for each runner! 

Hole in the Wall Gang Camp - Learn how you can help their childrens camp! 

Reach the Beach Merchandise

201 Atlantic Ave., North Hampton, NH

exchanges.name: TA35 - Winnacunnet High School
exchanges.description:
Winnacunnet High School (8)

1 Alumni Drive, Hampton, NH

exchanges.name: Start Line Thursday
exchanges.description:
Bretton Woods Ski Area

Thursday September 15th, 5-9PM. 

Hole in the Wall Gang Camp Pre Race Kick-off!: Bretton Woods Main Ski Lodge

  • Dinner- 5-9PM.  $25 purchase tickets here.  Includes dinner, drinks, dessert + 1 Harpoon Beer.
  • Jabra: Discounts, Give-aways and product information
  • Addaday – Roll out those muscles with a foam roller
  • Halfpops- sampling
  • NUUN:  Samples and product to purchase
  • Nathan – What Color is Your Pee? Photo banner; plus products for sale!
  • Bondi Band- No-slip headbands for sale
  • KIND Bar – Be sure to grab free Clif product for everyone on your team (We will give out in team bags so you may not want to list this……)
  • Runners Alley- Running essentials for purchase from their mobile Store

Reach the Beach Merchandise

legs.name: [New]
legs.notes:
Leg 9 is a NO VAN SUPPORT leg and an AUTOMATIC DISQUALIFICATION if your team is seen/caught pulling over along the shoulder of this route.  Sorry but we’re not kidding. 
The Town of Madison has threatened to prevent the race from using their roads in the future if they see vans pulling over so PLEASE DO NOT do this.  Drive directly to Exchange 9. 

Off Vans should bypass legs 9 and 10 and head to TA11 if they would like to rest. We recommend that runners carry water. Please note that school is in session until 3:45 PM please DO NOT park at the school before this time. There will be porto-johns, restrooms, and facility water on site.
legs.turn_by_turn:

6.4    Turn right to stay on Rt. 113 (run on RHS of road)
6.8    Arrive at Exchange 9

Madison, NH

Leg 10 is a NO VAN SUPPORT leg.

Please drive directly to TA10. There will be a water stop approximately 4 miles in.  There are a lot of narrow roads on this leg. Please use caution and be on alert the entire time. There will be port-o-johns, restrooms, and facility water on site.

There will be restrooms, port-o-johns, and facility water available at Exchange 12. This is also a Recycling Stop, so please be sure to offload your recyclables.

legs.name: [New]
legs.notes:
Exchange 24 is a great place to camp. Look for the Reebok Tent City between the parking lot and pavilion and grab one of our tents or pitch your own. But please keep your camping contained in the designated area.  

There will be restrooms, porto-johns, and facility water available for use. The Allentown Volunteer Fire Department will be serving hot food. They have been with us since Year 1, so be sure to pay them a visit!

legs.name: [New]
legs.notes:
Leg 25 is the second Wild Card Transition. You will see signs at mile 4.5 declaring the "Wild Card Transition Starts Here" and signs at mile 8.0 indicating where it ends.

The challenge is to have the runner for this leg and the runner for the next leg agree how far each one wishes to run. The runner for Leg 26 simply drives in the team van to the agreed upon distance from TA/Exchange 24 and waits for their teammate in order to handoff the baton.

travel.name: Travel Deals
travel.content:
Hotel Options

We’re happy to be partnering with North Conway Lodging who has four locations positioned close to the start of the Reach The Beach Relay: Eastern Slope Inn Resort, Attitash Mountain Village Hotel and Suites, Attitash Motel and the Oxen Yoke Inn and Motel.

For reservations, call (800) 862-1600 and don’t forget to tell them you’re with “Reach The Beach”.

We also have lodging partnerships with the following establishments:

  • Franconia Inn: Call (800) 473-5299 for more details and to make your reservation.
  • Best Western – White Mountain Inn: Call (888) 669-6777

Again, be sure to mention you’re with “Reach The Beach”.

 

Van Rental

Need to rent a van? Enterprise can hook you up!

GroupShift.responsibilities:
Direct runners to the correct hand-off or relay exchange zone.
Direct and assist team vehicles for parking.
Record team numbers and times as racers enter the relay exchange zone.
Assist and/or direct runners to food, water and restrooms.
Assist in final clean up of transition area.

sponsors.name: Hole In The Wall Gang Camp

reg_system.name: Reebok Reach The Beach
reg_system.description: Reebok Ragnar Reach The Beach (RTB) Relay is one of the oldest and longest running relay races in the United States. Reebok Reach the Beach will take place in picturesque New Hampshire during the start of the New England foliage season. The event will start at the Bretton Woods Ski area.From there, the course will take teams through the White Mountains of New Hampshire, past fields, lakes, mountain top vistas, and the occasional covered bridge ultimately finishing along the Atlantic coastline at Hampton Beach State Park – NH.Hampton Beach is located one hour from downtown Boston off of I-95 and is just 10 miles south of Portsmouth, NH. Its beautiful beaches and many state parks make it a major three-season tourist destination. The finish area at the Hampton Beach State Park will host a post-race party for all competitors, sponsors, volunteers, family and friends. There will also be provisions for massage, music, food, and fun.GREAT NEWS! All 2016 Reebok Ragnar Relay captains will be recieving free Reebok One Series running shoes!! As a captain, we know you are committed to going the distance and Reebok wants your feedback. Check out our Reebok Shoes page for more info!
